reviews.sentence: Home away from home. Myself and my husband stayed here for 3 weeks while he had to work in Toronto. The hotel staff were so helpful and they put a fridge and microwave in our room knowing we were there for a long stay and also greeted us with fruit and fancy water as a gesture for staying with them so long. The restaurant food was pricey but so is all of Canada but was lovely. The pool and gym were great. Best of all the bed covers were so soft and the mattress was cushioned it was like sleeping on a cloud. I would definitely be back when in Toronto again.

Nice hotel. Just stayed one day but everything was in good condition and pleasing. Only the wifi was surprisingly lousy. I ended up using my iphone to get a signal. However they did have a cable if anyone still uses those. Pool and gym were great. Restaurant seemed high end although I did nt have time to try it. Staff was super. Overall a great experience. Lobby is high end. Not the busiest area but nice. Wifi.

awesome pool and fitness facilities. awesome hotel. great pool and fitness facility. They waived the fee for wi fi. in this day and age you would think that would be free anyway. great rooms very large and bright. pool and size of room close to public transit so you can get anywhere you want to go without the issue of finding public parking free wi fi. they charge for it but they waived the fee.

awesome pool and fitness facilities. awesome hotel. great pool and fitness facility. They waived the fee for wi fi. in this day and age you would think that would be free anyway. great rooms very large and bright. pool and size of room close to public transit so you can get anywhere you want to go without the issue of finding public parking free wi fi. they charge for it but they waived the fee.

Excellent. Thanks to this hotel for making my business trip super comfortable. Easy checkin and also received an upgrade to the penthouse level. Clean modern hotel with restaurants and bar on site. Hotel has a clean modern well equipped gym to destress. I will stay here again.

I requested a higher floor with balcony at check in. I was given the fourth floor 404. No balcony. By the time we got to the room and realized we called down to request a change we waited over 10 minutes on hold. We hung up and settled. we should nt have. The room was hot hot hot could not get it to cool down. The bed was amazing perfect for a good sleep away from the kids for the night. Although waking up in a hot room is no fun. the sauna was amazing along with the workout room. i would nt go in to the hot tub as it did not look healthy especially after the couple who just got out. no complaints on the bathroom and the westin always has the best smelling bath products. having the name prince attached to the hotel i thought it would be a bit more royal.

Great stay cation for the family. We live in Toronto and our 10 year old wanted to have her birthday party at a hotel. We were there with 2 other 10 year old girls and the place suited our needs perfectly. there is a nice large outdoor pool tennis courts table tennis hot tub and lots of places to eat nearby as well as the hotel of course. The grounds are nice and our room was very spacious. The staff was very very friendly.

Recreational facilities the pool sauna and ping pong table were well used by us. I needed help on the second monrning of our stay with housekeeping my son had a soccer tournament and his socks were wet. I asked if they could let me put them in the drier for 10 minutes. They were unpleasant about it.

Nice hotel with great service. Stayed here many times for business. The hotel is very nice and the rooms are spacious. The restaurant bar has some delicious food and drinks. There are some nice restaurant across the street which is an easy walk. The gym and pool are nice. It is easy drive to The Shops at Don Mills which has more great restaurants. I think it is a little pricey since it is pretty far outside of downtown.
Good place for family with kids. Nice swimming pool and tennis court. Not really kind front desk.

Not sure how this can be a Westin. About the only two good things I can say about this hotel is that the beds are comfy the Westin trademark bedding and the staff were nice and helpful. Unfortunately everything else is a disaster. Let me start with the room. The safety latch on my door was broken and looks like us had been for some time and when I put a towel on the rack the rack broke too. Air conditioning was very loud the toilet would not flush right and the shower dripped all night. Oh yeah the television did not work either. The question is why did not I ask to move rooms or have these all fixed and the answer is that everyone at our conference had similar issues in their rooms. The conference facilities were in very poor shape as well think gaps in room dividers no power cords along the tables etc. The food both for the conference and at the main restaurant was inedible. I walked down the street to find a few chains so I could actually eat. The fitness center is way undersized for a hotel of this size I think there are four treadmills and of course the tv on my treadmill did not work either. The location is well outside of the city but still a good 30 minute ride to the airport. I would not recommend this hotel.

Great Customer Service Overcomes All. Stayed at the property as part of conference. Even though I arrived long before check in time the front desk staff got me a room. Room service was swift although typical hotel overpriced. My lunch arrived within 20 minutes of order and the food was hot and plentiful. On the 2nd day of my stay discovered that i could not receive any incoming calls. My maintenance man Mani was quick to diagnose that one of the phone lines had been cut by the group doing street repairs. MANI was extremely apologetic and offered to have my room moved. When I told him that this was unnecessary since I only had night left he promised some sort of compensation for my inconvenience. later in the day Mani showed up with a comp breakfast certificate and later the manager Krisandrasent me a handwritten note and chocolates. further apologizing. Problems aside this is a great hotel with great food and service. I highly recommend.

Beautiful Setting. The hotel is in a perfect location for people visiting Toronto who have need to be in the North York area of the city. My husband and I were visiting relatives and they all happen to live in that area so the hotel was perfect to use as our base for all the visitation. Our room was ready when we arrived which we appreciated since we had flown in from California and our flight had left very early in the morning. It was also very quiet which we really appreciated since we noticed that there were dozens of families staying there for a hockey tournament. Overall the Prince is clean comfortable and well maintained. Although the weather was not conducive to outside activities the grounds are beautiful as it backs onto a wooded area and there are tennis courts and a large swimming pool. The included breakfast was excellent with many choices and even an omelette station which we have not found to be typical in an included hotel buffet. There are also several restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel including Tim Hortons for those wanting something other than hotel food. Overall we would definitely recommend the Westin Prince Hotel.

Clean comfortable hotel good location. Very comfortable hotel staff were great. Room was good sized and well equipped. Buffet breakfast had lots of variety and everything appeared to be quite fresh and tasty. Only downsize was the quite pathetic gym very small only a few treadmills two stationary cycles and a few weight machines. No bigger than a home gym not in any way suitable for a major hotel with business travellers and active tourists. Gym needs to be totally overhauled small poorly equipped and crowded.

The lobby smell nice. There was no hot water in the morning. The locker in the gym locked all my personal items inside and it was not possible to unlock. The security guard and maintenance staff after 20 min. They could nt get my stuff out after 4 hours. It was not a pleasant.
quite close to several resturants. Gym facilities should be improved renovated. Parking charges are over.

Ok but rooms are dated. Sparse gym. Lobby is gorgeous. But rooms are very old and in need of serious updating. The gym equipment is sparse and not up to westin standards. Needs serious upgrade in that area as well. I will be staying in this area a lot and the sparse gym is stopping me from making this hotel my number one choice.

bathroom floor had to be cleaned after we arrived room is tired renovation seems in order noisy air circulation was impossible will not stay there again good gym and breakfast was very good. renovate the rooms spend some money.

Great hotel and facilities. I stayed here for 3 nights for a work conference. I really enjoyed my stayMy room was on the 4th floor and was very clean tidy and comfortable. The conference facilities were great. There is plenty of conference space available. In fact there were 2 other conferences at the same times as ours and there were no conflicts. The food was deliciousThey have a pool and a gym. what is really neat is that if you forget your gym items they can loan them to you for 5 use. Good to know if you want to get a work out in but forgot or did not have enough space to bring gym clothes. There is also ample free parking and restaurants across the street. I would stay here again.

Great night sleep but hotel grounds needs a bit of a refresher. Spent two nights here. Convenient spot in North York near 401 and DVP. Half an hour drive from downtown Toronto. Quick and efficient check in. The hotel looks quite run down from the exterior but the interior lobby has been refreshed and looks beautiful. The room and bathroom were very spacious and clean. With crisp white linen and towels. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable allowing a perfect night ’s sleep. We did enjoy some time by the outdoor pool. The pool water was fresh and clean. However the tiles and grout are starting to crack and in need of a bit of loving. The pool area is n’t very maintained and not the nicest. There were only 6 lounge chairs available i albeit the hot summer day. The tennis court had a crack in it and the ground was poorly maintained. The hotel conveniently has two restaurants next door one Japanese one and one Persian one. The Persian restaurant was a casual and tasty experience.
